wikipedia_page.main: Charles Howard Ellis (9 August 1830 – 17 January 1880) was an English cricketer active from 1856 to 1868 who played for Sussex. He was born in Ditchling and died in Brighton. He appeared in 80 first-class matches as a righthanded batsman who bowled underarm. He scored 1,812 runs with a highest score of 83 and took 100 wickets with a best performance of eight for 96.

response: * Charles Ellis, 1st Baron Seaford (1771–1845), British politician
* Charles Ellis, 6th Baron Howard de Walden (1799–1868), his son, British peer and politician
